ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk68:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk68:0.5_0: 68. The training rule on the ground
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk68:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk68:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six were sitting on the ground giving teachings to people sitting on seats. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk68:1.3.1_0: “‘I will not give a teaching while sitting on the ground to anyone sitting on a seat who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk68:1.4_0: One should not give a teaching while sitting on the ground to anyone sitting on a seat who is not sick.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk68:1.5_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, gives a teaching while sitting on the ground to someone sitting on a seat who is not sick, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk68:1.7.1_0: or it has not been trusted ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk68:1.9_0: The eighth rule, the training rule on weavers, is finished.
